page.title: 03HOUSING IN IRWELL VALLEY
page.content: Most of the houses in our block are concentrated in the eastern quarter,in the villages of Edenfield and Stubbins.Ninety per cent of the houses are terraced or semi-detached.The terraces were mainly built in the 19th century from locally quarried stone.Most of the semi-detached houses are on estates,including one large council estate,and are made of brick.There are one or two smaller estates of detached houses.There are very few flats,all of which are in low-rise blocks.Among the oldest houses in the area are the {CROFTERS' {COTTAGES}in Market Street,Edenfield, and{LUMB MANOR HOUSE}nearby.The most recent houses have just been built on a small development at Church Lane near Edenfield Parish Church.
